title: How to Remove Autofill on iPhone: Passwords, Browser History & More

steps.title: Open your iPhone’s Settings.
steps.content: Open your iPhone’s Settings. It’s the app on your home screen with a gray gear icon. When Safari automatically enters your name and contact details into a form field, the information comes from your Contacts card. This method helps you prevent Safari from pulling information from Contacts so you don’t have to delete your own Contact card. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Apps > Safari.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Apps > Safari . The Apps option is at the bottom of the Settings screen. Safari will be under the "S" heading.

steps.title: Tap AutoFill.
steps.content: Tap AutoFill . It’s in the “General” section.

steps.title: Slide the “Use Contact Info” switch to the Off position.
steps.content: Slide the “Use Contact Info” switch to the Off position. The switch will turn gray, and Safari will no longer pull your name, phone number, or address from your information in Contacts.

steps.title: Open your iPhone’s Settings.
steps.content: Open your iPhone’s Settings. It’s the app on your home screen with a gray gear icon.

steps.title: Tap General.
steps.content: Tap General . It's near the middle of your screen, with an icon of a gray gear.

steps.title: Tap AutoFill & Passwords.
steps.content: Tap AutoFill & Passwords . You may have to scroll to see this option.

steps.title: Toggle off AutoFill Passwords and Passkeys.
steps.content: Toggle off AutoFill Passwords and Passkeys . You can also choose which places AutoFill will autofill passwords from, if you don't want to disable AutoFill for passwords completely.

steps.title: Open your iPhone’s Settings.
steps.content: Open your iPhone’s Settings. It’s the app on your home screen with a gray gear icon.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Apps > Safari.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Apps > Safari . The Apps option is at the bottom of the Settings screen. Safari will be under the "S" heading.

steps.title: Tap AutoFill.
steps.content: Tap AutoFill . It’s in the “General” section.

steps.title: Tap Saved Credit Cards.
steps.content: Tap Saved Credit Cards .

steps.title: Enter your passcode.
steps.content: Enter your passcode. If you aren’t asked to enter a passcode, you don’t have any AutoFill data stored.

steps.title: Tap Edit.
steps.content: Tap Edit . It’s at the top right corner of the screen.

steps.title: Select cards to delete from AutoFill.
steps.content: Select cards to delete from AutoFill.

steps.title: Tap Delete.
steps.content: Tap Delete . It’s at the top left corner of the screen. These cards will no longer be suggested when filling out forms in Safari. To prevent Safari from saving cards for AutoFill in the future, tap the back button, then slide the “Credit Cards” switch to the Off position (gray). [2] X Research source

steps.title: Open Safari.
steps.content: Open Safari. If you want to remove the autofill that occurs when you start typing in a website address in Safari, you can do so from inside the Safari app.

steps.title: Tap the book icon at the bottom of the screen.
steps.content: Tap the book icon at the bottom of the screen. This will bring up your browsing history.

steps.title: Tap the red Clear button.
steps.content: Tap the red Clear button. It's in the bottom-right corner of the screen.

steps.title: Choose a clear timeframe.
steps.content: Choose a clear timeframe. You can choose to clear your browsing history from the last hour, today, today and yesterday, or all of your browsing history.

steps.title: Choose if you want to close your tabs.
steps.content: Choose if you want to close your tabs. If you want to close all the currently open tabs you have in Safari as well, toggle on Close All Tabs .

steps.title: Tap Clear History.
steps.content: Tap Clear History . Once you do so, your browsing history for the selected timeframe will be cleared immediately.

steps.title: Open the Chrome app.
steps.content: Open the Chrome app. You are able to edit settings for the Chrome app directly within the app.

steps.title: Tap ⋯ > Delete Browsing Data.
steps.content: Tap ⋯ > Delete Browsing Data . This will open the browsing history deletion menu.

steps.title: Choose a time range.
steps.content: Choose a time range. You can select anywhere from "last hour" to "all time."

steps.title: Select what you want to delete.
steps.content: Select what you want to delete. Uncheck anything you don't want to delete. Choose Browsing history to remove browsing history autofill. Choose Saved passwords to remove passwords autofill. Choose Autofill data to remove any other autofill data (such as addresses and emails).

steps.title: Tap Delete browsing data at the bottom of the screen.
steps.content: Tap Delete browsing data at the bottom of the screen. Your browsing data will immediately be deleted. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Open the Chrome app.
steps.content: Open the Chrome app. You are able to edit settings for the Chrome app directly within the app.

steps.title: Tap ⋯.
steps.content: Tap ⋯ . It's in the bottom right corner.

steps.title: Select Settings.
steps.content: Select Settings . It's in the horizontally scrolling list of icons at the top of the menu. You will need to scroll all the way to the right to see it.

steps.title: Tap Password Manager.
steps.content: Tap Password Manager . It's in the middle of the screen, with a yellow icon of a key.

steps.title: Tap Settings in the bottom-left corner.
steps.content: Tap Settings in the bottom-left corner. You may be asked to enable Face ID before you're able to interact with this menu.

steps.title: Toggle off Offer to save passwords.
steps.content: Toggle off Offer to save passwords . When done, tap Done in the upper-right corner, then tap < Settings in the upper-left corner.

steps.title: Tap Payment Methods.
steps.content: Tap Payment Methods . It's in the middle of the screen, with a yellow icon of a credit card.

steps.title: Toggle off Save and Fill Payment Methods.
steps.content: Toggle off Save and Fill Payment Methods . When done, tap < Settings in the upper-left corner.

steps.title: Tap Addresses and More.
steps.content: Tap Addresses and More . It's in the middle of the screen, with a yellow icon of a location pin.

steps.title: Toggle off Save and Fill Addresses.
steps.content: Toggle off Save and Fill Addresses . When done, tap < Settings in the upper-left corner.

steps.title: Open the Firefox app.
steps.content: Open the Firefox app. You are able to edit settings for the Firefox app directly within the app.

steps.title: Tap ≡.
steps.content: Tap ≡ . It's in the bottom right corner.

steps.title: Tap Settings.
steps.content: Tap Settings . It's at the bottom of the list, with an icon of a cogwheel.

steps.title: Scroll down to the Privacy heading.
steps.content: Scroll down to the Privacy heading. It's about halfway down the page.

steps.title: Choose the area you want to remove autofill data from.
steps.content: Choose the area you want to remove autofill data from. You can select Passwords , Payment Methods , or Addresses . Unlike Chrome, you must remove each autofill entry individually. To remove a payment method or address, tap on the entry you want to remove, then tap Edit > Remove [address/card] . To remove a password, tap on the entry, then tap Delete .

steps.title: Open the Firefox app.
steps.content: Open the Firefox app. You are able to edit settings for the Firefox app directly within the app.

steps.title: Tap ≡.
steps.content: Tap ≡ . It's in the bottom right corner.

steps.title: Tap Settings.
steps.content: Tap Settings . It's at the bottom of the list, with an icon of a cogwheel.

steps.title: Tap Data Management.
steps.content: Tap Data Management . It's under the Privacy heading, about halfway down the page.

steps.title: Toggle on Browsing History.
steps.content: Toggle on Browsing History . Toggle off anything you don't want to delete.

steps.title: Tap Clear Private Data.
steps.content: Tap Clear Private Data . Your browsing history will immediately be removed and will no longer autofill when you try to type in your browser's URL bar.

steps.title: Open the Firefox app.
steps.content: Open the Firefox app. You are able to edit settings for the Firefox app directly within the app.

steps.title: Tap ≡.
steps.content: Tap ≡ . It's in the bottom right corner.

steps.title: Tap Settings.
steps.content: Tap Settings . It's at the bottom of the list, with an icon of a cogwheel.

steps.title: Scroll down to the Privacy heading.
steps.content: Scroll down to the Privacy heading. It's about halfway down the page.

steps.title: Tap Passwords.
steps.content: Tap Passwords . It's the top option under Privacy . You may be asked to enable Face ID before you're able to interact with this menu.

steps.title: Toggle off Save Passwords.
steps.content: Toggle off Save Passwords . When done, tap < Settings in the upper-left corner.

steps.title: Tap Payment Methods.
steps.content: Tap Payment Methods . It's the second option under Privacy . You may be asked to enable Face ID before you're able to interact with this menu.

steps.title: Toggle off Save and Fill Payment Methods.
steps.content: Toggle off Save and Fill Payment Methods . When done, tap < Settings in the upper-left corner.

steps.title: Tap Addresses.
steps.content: Tap Addresses . It's the third option under Privacy .

steps.title: Toggle off Save and Fill Addresses.
steps.content: Toggle off Save and Fill Addresses . When done, tap < Settings in the upper-left corner.
